io.vertx.ext.jwt

Class JWT

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.vertx.ext.jwt.JWT

  • public final class JWT
extends Object
    JWT and JWS implementation draft-ietf-oauth-json-web-token-32.
    Author:
    Paulo Lopes

    • Method Detail

      • addJWK

        public JWT addJWK(JWK jwk)
        Adds a JSON Web Key (rfc7517) to the crypto map.
        Parameters:
        jwk - a JSON Web Key
        Returns:
        self

      • addPublicKey

        @Deprecated
public JWT addPublicKey(String algorithm,
                                    String key)
        Deprecated. Replaced by addJWK(JWK)
        Adds a public key for a given JWS algorithm to the crypto map. This is an alternative to using keystores since it is common to see these keys when dealing with 3rd party services such as Google or Keycloak.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the JWS algorithm, e.g.: RS256
        key - the base64 DER format of the key (also known as PEM format, without the header and footer).
        Returns:
        self

      • addKeyPair

        @Deprecated
public JWT addKeyPair(String algorithm,
                                  String publicKey,
                                  String privateKey)
        Deprecated. Replaced by addJWK(JWK)
        Adds a key pair for a given JWS algorithm to the crypto map. This is an alternative to using keystores since it is common to see these keys when dealing with 3rd party services such as Google or Keycloak.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the JWS algorithm, e.g.: RS256
        publicKey - the base64 DER format of the key (also known as PEM format, without the header and footer).
        privateKey - the base64 DER format of the key (also known as PEM format, without the header and footer).
        Returns:
        self

      • addSecretKey

        @Deprecated
public JWT addSecretKey(String algorithm,
                                    String key)
        Deprecated. Replaced by addJWK(JWK)
        Adds a private key for a given JWS algorithm to the crypto map. This is an alternative to using keystores since it is common to see these keys when dealing with 3rd party services such as Google.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the JWS algorithm, e.g.: RS256
        key - the base64 DER format of the key (also known as PEM format, without the header and footer).
        Returns:
        self

      • addCertificate

        @Deprecated
public JWT addCertificate(String algorithm,
                                      String cert)
        Deprecated. Replaced by addJWK(JWK)
        Adds a certificate for a given JWS algorithm to the crypto map. This is an alternative to using keystores since it is common to see these keys when dealing with 3rd party services such as Google.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the JWS algorithm, e.g.: RS256
        cert - the base64 DER format of the key (also known as PEM format, without the header and footer).
        Returns:
        self

      • addSecret

        @Deprecated
public JWT addSecret(String algorithm,
                                 String key)
        Deprecated. Replaced by addJWK(JWK)
        Adds a secret (password) for a given JWS algorithm to the crypto map. This is an alternative to using keystores since it is common to see these keys when dealing with 3rd party services such as Google.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the JWS algorithm, e.g.: HS256
        key - the base64 DER format of the key (also known as PEM format, without the header and footer).
        Returns:
        self
